1100460059535044608.text:
I reckon in the last year I have saved +$10k in travel expenses with these little tricks.

Have fun!

1100460058423582727.text: 16/ Final trick. If you are in premium economy. When they give you the wine, try it and then ask if they have anything different. Look sad. Usually, they will bring you business class wine which is much nicer.

1100460057131733000.text:
15/ If you are scared of flying freak like me then there are some great websites, just Google safety records:
- British Airways are great
- A380 has never had a fatal accident

This shit matters!

1100460055080644608.text:
14/ Oh a couple more things:
- Sometimes a return flight is cheaper than single when international
- If you book a connecting flight to save cost but don't get on the first flight then they won't let you on the second (I got caught out with this once)

1100460054103363585.text:
13/ Oh yeah, people are starting to love Norwegian:
- Can be cheap but when adding food and bags may not be
- In-flight entertainment is crap so bring films
- Pack food
- If they offer bid for premium, offer pretty much the lowest price

1100460053092544513.text:
12/ Other things:
- Get currency before you leave, get too much, you will get free returns
- Cash machine and card charges can really add up
- If you travel more than once - annual travel insurance is usually better
- Don't read about plane crashes on a plane
- Don't fly on a 757

1100460051867815938.text:
11/ With renting a car you can use price comparisons, and you will get little unheard of places. They get you a lower price in the comparison by charging a lot more for insurance when you pick up the car.

I tend to use comparison sites but go with the most prominent companies.

1100460050680819718.text: 10/ If hotels seem expensive then always check against Airbnb. Sometimes there isn't much difference, sometimes it can be half the price and you get a nice little house.

1100460049464479744.text:
9/ If you don't know the hotel you want, I always start with http://Hotels.com :
- Search area
- Filter by acceptable star rating
- Whoever has a low price has too much inventory
- Then take that hotel into Trivago (rinse repeat)

1100460048160096262.text:
8/ Also check the price on the hotel website. If it is similar, then book direct. If you book through one of the aggregators, they will always give you the shittiest room they can.

Never use the mini-bar, $5 for M&Ms, behave!

Breakfast is never worth $30, go somewhere local.

1100460046817943558.text:
7/ For hotels, if you know where you want to stay always check Trivago first, they will find the site with the best price.

If the lowest price is someone like http://Hotels.com :
- Google discount code
- Use Quidco

You can usually save 10-30%.

1100460045765091335.text:
7/ Only notes of caution:
a. Don't ever expect to change the flight, it is fixed and if you can't make it then tough.
b. Very occasionally they will call you and say you can't get one of your flight and have a connection instead. This has happened like 1 in 15 flights for me.

1100460044305481728.text:
6/ Hence just now I booked a AA return flight, operated by BA through Get4Flight on the Momondo website for £334, the same seats through BA are £946.72.

THEY ARE EXACTLY THE SAME SEATS.

Use the difference to premium economy or buy some new shoes.

1100460042954985473.text:
5/ You can usually click through and it will say something like American Airlines (Operated by British Airways).

BA is always more expensive than the others but you can book the American flight and you're getting the same seat but on British Airways.

1100460041675640832.text:
4/ Another trick is the airlines all sell each other's flights if they are part of a group. For example, One World is BA, American, FinAir etc...

I prefer BA as they have a good safety record and I don't want to die. In the results, you will have the other airlines.

Cont...

1100460040383807490.text:
3/ The Cheapest place I have found to get a flight is Momondo.

They include all these ropey agents you have never heard of such as Get4Flight. It seems like the airlines occasionally release blocks to them.

Keep checking back regularly, I expect 1/3 of airline listed price.

1100460038278336514.text:
2/ For whatever reason sometimes you can get a combined booking cheaper than separate.

I tend to find this like 1 in 4 bookings. The combined ones tend to be cheaper in busier travel periods - holidays etc...

1100460037263237121.text:
1/ Thread on travel tricks. I fly so much I have got this shit nailed.

So the first thing I do is know where I am going and where I want to stay, then I:
- Research combined hotel and flight with Expedia and Last Minute
- Research separate flight and hotel

Compare & book.

1100450992703897600.text:

Anyway, see you in New York, will be there Sun to Wed.
